connected_components.description: Can be used to drive the EN pin with a PWM signal for dimming control or a simple high/low signal for enabling/disabling the device.

While not explicitly required for basic enable/disable functionality, a pull-down resistor to GND might be considered in some designs to ensure the device remains disabled if the microcontroller output is in a high-impedance state.
A stable voltage source (e.g., VCC, 3.3V, 5V) can be used to permanently enable the device if PWM dimming is not required.

implementation.connectivity: The EN pin can be connected to a microcontroller's digital output pin for PWM dimming or to a voltage source to enable/disable the device. For disabling the device, it should be connected to GND. For enabling, it should be connected to a sufficient positive voltage (refer to the 'Enable Voltage' characteristic in the datasheet).
implementation.detailed_description: The EN pin is used to enable or disable the biasing transistor within the BCR421U. It controls the overall operation of the device, allowing for it to be turned on or off.
implementation.functionality: The EN pin acts as an enable for the biasing transistor. When the EN pin is pulled high (above a certain voltage threshold), the biasing transistor is enabled, and the device starts regulating the output current. When the EN pin is pulled low (typically to GND), the biasing transistor is disabled, and the output current is effectively turned off. This pin can also be pulse-width modulated (PWM) by a microcontroller for LED dimming purposes, up to a frequency of 25kHz.
precautions: Ensure the voltage applied to the EN pin does not exceed the 'Enable Voltage' absolute maximum rating (18V for BCR421U).
When using PWM for dimming, ensure the frequency does not exceed 25kHz, as specified in the datasheet.
To disable the device, the EN pin should be reliably pulled to GND.
The datasheet specifies a minimum output voltage (VOUT(MIN)) for the device to operate correctly. This should be considered when designing the LED string and selecting the REXT value.

connected_components.description: A conductive layer on the printed circuit board used as a common reference for electrical potential, typically connected to the negative terminal of the power supply.
The ground terminal of the power supply unit providing voltage to the circuit.

implementation.connectivity: The GND pin must be connected to the ground rail of the power supply and the ground of the circuit. It should be connected directly to the ground plane on the PCB for optimal thermal performance and noise reduction.
implementation.detailed_description: The GND pin is the power ground connection for the BCR420U and BCR421U Constant Current Regulators (CCRs). It serves as the reference point for all voltage measurements and is essential for the proper operation of the internal circuitry.
implementation.functionality: The primary function of the GND pin is to provide a common ground reference for the device. It is also used as the return path for the output current (IOUT) and the enable current (IEN).
implementation.precautions: Ensure a low-impedance connection to ground to minimize voltage drops and noise. Proper grounding is critical for the thermal management of the device, as heat generated by the device is dissipated through the ground connection. Avoid long or thin traces for the ground connection.

implementation.connectivity: In a schematic, the N/C pin should not be connected to anything. It should be left floating or explicitly marked as N/C.
implementation.detailed_description: The N/C pin on the BCR420U/BCR421U is designated as 'Not Connected Internally'. This means there is no internal circuitry connected to this pin within the device.
implementation.functionality: The N/C pin does not have any active functionality. It is not connected internally and therefore does not contribute to the operation of the device.
implementation.precautions: It is important not to connect any external components or signals to the N/C pin. Connecting signals or power to this pin could potentially lead to unexpected behavior or damage to the device, as its internal state is not designed to handle external connections.

connected_components.description: The device is designed to drive LEDs. The OUT pin should be connected in series with the anode of the first LED in the string, and the cathode of the last LED in the string should be connected to GND.

An external resistor (Rext) connects to the Rext pin to adjust the output current from the preset 10mA up to 350mA. The value of Rext determines the output current, as shown in the R_EXT vs I_OUT graphs in the datasheet. A lower tolerance Rext will improve current accuracy.

implementation.connectivity: The OUT pin should be connected in series with the LED or string of LEDs. The current flows from the power supply, through the LED(s), to the OUT pin of the BCR420U/BCR421U. The other end of the LED string is connected to ground.
implementation.detailed_description: The OUT pin is the regulated output current for the LED driver. The device regulates the current through this pin to a preset 10mA nominal, which can be adjusted up to 350mA using an external resistor connected to the Rext pin. This pin is designed to drive LEDs in strings and has a negative temperature coefficient to self-protect at higher temperatures.
implementation.functionality: The primary function of the OUT pin is to provide a regulated constant current. The magnitude of this current is determined by the internal circuitry and the external resistor (Rext). For the BCR421U, the EN pin can also influence the output current by enabling or disabling the device or being used for PWM dimming.
precautions: Ensure the voltage across the device (V_OUT) plus the voltage across the LED string does not exceed the maximum supply voltage rating (40V).

Adequate thermal management is crucial, especially when operating at higher currents. The power dissipation (PD) must be considered, and the PCB copper area should be selected according to the thermal characteristic graphs to prevent overheating.

The minimum output voltage required for regulation is VOUT(MIN) = 1.4V (IOUT > 18mA for BCR421U) or VOUT(MIN) = 1.4V (IOUT > 18mA for BCR420U). Ensure the LED string voltage drop allows for this minimum voltage at the OUT pin.
For higher current operation, ensure sufficient enable current is provided by increasing the enable voltage (V_EN), as shown in Figure 7 for 350mA operation with BCR421U.

Rext.description: External Resistor for Adjusting Output Current

connected_components.details: An external resistor is connected between the Rext pin and the GND pin. The value of this resistor is chosen to achieve the desired output current, with higher resistance values resulting in lower output currents. For maximum current of 350mA, a specific low resistance value is needed, and for the preset 10mA, the Rext should be open (no resistor).

implementation.connectivity: The Rext pin should be connected to an external resistor, which is then connected to the GND pin. The value of this resistor determines the output current. The datasheet provides graphs of REXT vs IOUT to aid in selecting the appropriate resistor value.
implementation.detailed_description: The Rext pin is used to adjust the output current (IOUT) of the Constant Current Regulator (CCR). By connecting an external resistor (Rext) between the Rext pin and GND, the user can set the output current to a value up to 350mA. The internal resistor (RINT) of the device works in parallel with the external Rext resistor to determine the final output current.
implementation.functionality: The Rext pin's primary function is to adjust the output current. The output current is inversely proportional to the resistance value of the external resistor connected to this pin. When no external resistor is connected (Rext is open), the device operates at its preset minimum current (typically 10mA).
precautions: Ensure the chosen Rext resistor has a low tolerance for improved current accuracy, as the accuracy of the current sense depends on the parallel combination of RINT and REXT.
Refer to the Rext vs IOUT graphs provided in the datasheet to select the appropriate resistor value for the desired output current.
If no external resistor is used (Rext is open), the device will operate at its preset minimum current.
